description.en: Born of a brahmin called Nāgeśa in the village called Maṅgala of the Chola country, the erudite saint well-known as Śrī Jñānottama, foremost among logicians, having adorned the Pīṭha of preceptors for sixty-three years, attained salvation/siddhi on the seventh day of the bright fortnight in the month of Mārgaśīrṣa of the year Manmatha.

shlokas:
jAtO maGgalanAmni cOlaviSayE nAgEzasaMjJAd dvijAcchrIjJAnOttama ityavAptabirudO yastArkikAgrEsaraH.
jJAnAnandamunistriSaSTizaradaH sammaNDya pIThIM gurOH siddhiM manmathamArgazIrSasitasaptamyAm avApatsudhIH..12..
—puNyazlOkamaJjarI
